intro: Cacalia divergens, commonly known as the bluebell of the woods, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in a loose cluster and bloom in late spring to early summer. Cacalia divergens is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a food source for pollinators.
